definition: surname Mo/abbr. for 墨西哥[Mo4 xi1 ge1], Mexico
ink stick/China ink/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/corporal punishment consisting of tattooing characters on the victim's forehead
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: If your ink block is ground unevenly(12), it shows you have a poor state of mind(13).
sentences.chinese: 如果墨条磨的偏向一边，显示出你的心地不庄重。

sentences.english: If my ink block is ground unevenly, it shows I have poor state of mind.
sentences.chinese: 墨条如果被磨的偏向一边，就表明自己的心不端正。

definition: fine writing paper, originally from Jing county 涇縣|泾县, Xuancheng 宣城, Anhui
high-quality ink stonemade in Duanxi and Guangdong
Four Treasures of the Study, namely 筆|笔[bi3], 墨[mo4], 紙|纸[zhi3] and 硯|砚[yan4]/the essentials of calligraphy and scholarship (idiom)
fine paper made from bamboo, used for calligraphy, painting etc/also written 毛邊|毛边[mao2 bian1]
red ink paste used for seal
ability to write/writing skill/written/in written form
